text: Ballynacarrow, locally Ballinacarrow (), is a village in County Sligo, Ireland. It is located approximately south-west of Sligo town. The Temple House estate is south of the village. The population was 202, as of the 2016 Census. This was the first census for which village data was specifically recorded. ==Transport== Ballynacarrow is on the N17 Galway to Collooney road. The village is a stop on the Bus Éireann Galway to Derry Expressway route 64. ==People== The Irish-American orator and politician Bourke Cockran was born in Ballynacarrow in 1854. ==See also== * List of towns and villages in Ireland ==References== Category:Towns and villages in County Sligo
title: Ballynacarrow
